snippet: The Hungarian foreign minister said the country was taking action because the European Union had yet to come up with a comprehensive plan to deal with the flow of people.
abstract: Hungary closes its border with Croatia to stop migrants crossing through on their way further into Europe; Foreign Min Peter Szijjarto says closure is due to completion of razor-wire fence and concerns that European Union has not yet come up with plan to deal with migrants.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Higgins from Brussels; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; Palko Karasz from London; Joseph Orovic from Zadar, Croatia; Balint Bardi from Budapest; and Barbara Surk from Ljubljana, Slovenia.

lead_paragraph: The Hungarian foreign minister said the country was taking action because the European Union had yet to come up with a comprehensive plan to deal with the flow of people.

headline.main: Hungary Seals Border With Croatia in Migrant Crackdown

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
